text: 124.4. Decode Directories (Number of Entries) The following is the hexdump of a directory that uses the following structure for its dirents. struct dirent { ino_t d_ino; // 32 bits __uint16_t d_reclen; __uint8_t d_type; __uint8_t d_namlen; char d_name[255+1]; i #define DT_DIR 4 #define DT_REG 8 #define DT_LNK 10 How many valid entries are in this directory? 0000000 00 00 10 00 Oc 00 04 01 2e 00 00 00 01 00 10 00 0000010 0c 00 04 02 2e 2e 00 00 64 00 00 00 1c 00 08 10 0000020 50 65 72 65 67 72 69 6e 65 20 66 61 6C 63 6T 6e 0000030 00 00 00 42 65 00 00 00 10 00 0a 06 43 61 74 74 0000040 6c 65 00 6e 02 00 10 00 10 00 04 06 4d 61 72 6d 0000050 6T 74 00 6e 66 00 00 00 10 00 0a 07 43 68 69 63 0000060 6b 65 6e 00 67 00 00 00 10 00 0a 06 4a 61 67 75 0000070 61 72 00 00 00 00 00 00 20 00 08 14 57 61 74 65 0000080 72 20 62 75 66 66 61 6Cc 6f 20 62 72 65 65 64 73 0000090 00 00 00 00 68 00 00 00 14 00 0a 0a 47 75 69 6e 0000020 65 61 20 70 69 67 00 6Cc 69 00 00 00 20 00 08 14 00000b0 57 61 74 65 72 20 62 75 66 66 61 6C 6 20 62 72 00000c0 65 65 64 73 00 00 00 00 00000c8 integer (-] Save & Grade Single attempt Additional attempts available with new variants @
